    table::buildWhereArrayFromRequest
    


    
buildWhereArrayFromRequest(
[Bool
$full_like = NULL] );

    

	

		
    Parameters
    
			
    $full_like
    
		
    Will set all TEXT filter to %like% Default is like%
    
			
    Returns
    
		
    Where string
    

    Remarks
    

    This function will take in the information from the $_REQUEST global vars  from a filter and conver it to a WHERE statement to be append to a query  to filter the output

    table::getFilterType
    


    
getFilterType(
String
$type, String
$key, [Array
$content = NULL] );

    

	

		
    Parameters
    
			
    $type
    
		
    
			
    $key
    
		
    fields name for a column
    
			
    $content
    
		
    An array of field information for COMPILE type
    
		
    Remarks
    

    This function will create a filter for a field  based on its type
    

    Filter types.  TEXT : A text box, entered text will do a like% search on the feild  VALUE : A select box and a text box, select show =,<=, >=, <> , text box hold the value  COMPILED : A Selct box showing all the possible entries in the Field  MONEY : see VALUE
    
	
    access
    
		
    private
    
	
    [ Top ]

    table::setFilter
    


    
setFilter(
Array
$filterArray );

    

	

		
    Parameters
    
			
    $filterArray
    
		
    
		
    Remarks
    

    Will using an input of an associated array add apply a filter type to a field name
    

    eg.  $array['name'] = 'TEXT';  $array['age'] = 'VALUE';
    Filter types.  TEXT : A text box, entered text will do a like% search on the feild  VALUE : A select box and a text box, select show =,<=, >=, <> , text box hold the value  COMPILED : A Selct box showing all the possible entries in the Field
    
	
    access
    
		
    public
    
	
    [ Top ]

    table::setHeader
    


    
setHeader(
Array
$headerArray );

    

	

		
    Parameters
    
			
    $headerArray
    
		
    
		
    Remarks
    

    Will using an input of an associated array to rewite field names  to more readable header, if no match is found the header will be the field name
    

    An Accociated array with the key the name of the field and the value the name to change too  eg.  $array['col1'] = 'First Column';  $array['col2'] = 'Second Column';
    
	
    access
    
		
    public
    
	
    [ Top ]
